E9C026D05526439393C26939410D77E4.description: Modify budgets displayed in various ways to reflect specific changes in circumstances, and provide a rationale for the modifications

A938D5D6BFCA4279AAB72694690950CF.description: Compare the effects that different interest rates, lengths of borrowing time, ways in which interest is calculated, and amounts of down payments have on the overall costs associated with purchasing goods or services, using appropriate tools

ED1033D9DC0643D7A0CDA9027F5EC968.description: Identify financial situations that involve appreciation and depreciation, and use associated graphs to answer related questions

B7096026B5C046C5ABE88D04664EB0D4.description: Identify a past or current financial situation and explain how it can inform financial decisions, by applying an understanding of the context of the situation and related mathematical knowledge

EE1619AFD6AB4FA5800F9C0185574098.description: Demonstrate the knowledge and skills needed to make informed financial decisions

9A28DDE689D8496BB94C80B52F9366C5.description: Solve problems using the relationships between the volume of prisms and pyramids and between the volume of cylinders and cones, involving various units of measure

665C90A22203427686AD2D68222008C9.description: Solve problems involving the side-length relationship for right triangles in real-life situations, including problems that involve composite shapes

04B9C394BC2547E1A160A196FA91379F.description: Show how changing one or more dimensions of a two-dimensional shape and a three-dimensional object affects perimeter/circumference, area, surface area, and volume, using technology when appropriate

8BE9B010194B4C9AADB295B4F57F5D9C.description: Solve problems involving different units within a measurement system and between measurement systems, including those from various cultures or communities, using various representations and technology, when appropriate

3A33BEE84A814A189117464C6538B00D.description: Create and analyse designs involving geometric relationships and circle and triangle properties, using various tools

E8F180B1CD62418D9B1108C133780212.description: Research a geometric concept or a measurement system to tell a story about its development and use in a specific culture or community, and describe its relevance in connection to careers and to other disciplines

AE0E34F66976476B99996BB9C97A1856.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the development and use of geometric and measurement relationships, and apply these relationships to solve problems, including problems involving real-life situations

45BEF91830124F70B45D7AF25D54F9AA.description: Report how the model can be used to answer the question of interest, how well the model fits the context, potential limitations of the model, and what predictions can be made based on the model

D76DBA430FDC4A5780CC537754C7B371.description: Determine ways to display and analyse the data in order to create a mathematical model to answer the original question of interest, taking into account the nature of the data, the context, and the assumptions made

C09DDA645D7F45FDB9015C4864A1BA9B.description: Create a plan to collect the necessary data on the question of interest from an appropriate source, identify assumptions, identify what may vary and what may remain the same in the situation, and then carry out the plan

870CF7D4B7A64F26B3EF0CCD9DC72B77.description: Identify a question of interest requiring the collection and analysis of data, and identify the information needed to answer the question

BF58303847914DBCAF9F22027BF39514.description: Describe the value of mathematical modelling and how it is used in real life to inform decisions

143B1833A09F4E368A2BBE5B43B1E17E.description: Apply the process of mathematical modelling, using data and mathematical concepts from other strands, to represent, analyse, make predictions, and provide insight into real-life situations

5A44A79CB50B471988FC2FDB0CC64016.description: Create a scatter plot to represent the relationship between two variables, determine the correlation between these variables by testing different regression models using technology, and use a model to make predictions when appropriate

F33751C2F2BF4561B055CB16CBB361DA.description: Represent and statistically analyse data from a real-life situation involving a single variable in various ways, including the use of quartile values and box plots

3B29BCD1CD4647C9833EEBA39A002E57.description: Identify a current context involving a large amount of data, and describe potential implications and consequences of its collection, storage, representation, and use

B98CE46908034A62B3019184B8BD2A0E.description: Describe the collection and use of data, and represent and analyse data involving one and two variables

45A2A89DAFB44BDAB5CD9E9F092AC39D.description: Determine the equations of lines from graphs, tables of values, and concrete representations of linear relations by making connections between rates of change and slopes, and between initial values and y-intercepts, and use these equations to solve problems

1C3A20FD16A74D72990A83F4543961C6.description: Translate, reflect, and rotate lines defined by y = ax, where a is a constant, and describe how each transformation affects the graphs and equations of the defined lines

A8E3BE64CD1E43348DA942F0CBB5FAA9.description: Graph relations represented as algebraic equations of the forms x = k, y = k, x + y = k, x ï¿½ y = k, ax + by = k, and xy = k, and their associated inequalities, where a, b, and k are constants, to identify various characteristics and the points and/or regions defined by these equations and inequalities

F331DD10EA3E425199AF4F9E2C0C6963.description: Compare characteristics of graphs, tables of values, and equations of linear and non-linear relations

932FBF53CC534DCE87653C80D0AB8405.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the characteristics of various representations of linear and non-linear relations, using tools, including coding when appropriate

CEC728CB89CD47E887697290D7588D3E.description: Compare two linear relations of the form y = ax + b graphically and algebraically, and interpret the meaning of their point of intersection in terms of a given context

CEDA6B691339466CB63D29D298511ADE.description: Represent linear relations using concrete materials, tables of values, graphs, and equations, and make connections between the various representations to demonstrate an understanding of rates of change and initial values

C73A2562BE884B99936068C0B8112397.description: Compare the shapes of graphs of linear and non-linear relations to describe their rates of change, to make connections to growing and shrinking patterns, and to make predictions

E607478F94FC4747B8D153035B55FDC6.description: Represent and compare linear and non-linear relations that model real-life situations, and use these representations to make predictions

451E8A1D922C42EB9A6CEBD23DA9E055.description: Read code to predict its outcome, and alter code to adjust constraints, parameters, and outcomes to represent a similar or new mathematical situation

4B3D17209C1F43E1A993F873ADFFBEC8.description: Create code by decomposing situations into computational steps in order to represent mathematical concepts and relationships, and to solve problems

5D4876179AF244A5AE403586327E4CA5.description: Use coding to demonstrate an understanding of algebraic concepts including variables, parameters, equations, and inequalities

8BD54FE23423432CABE2189364770A81.description: Apply coding skills to represent mathematical concepts and relationships dynamically, and to solve problems, in algebra and across the other strands

5D2C37BE05344A10B204B97DA443E50C.description: Create and solve equations for various contexts, and verify their solutions

E49882AAF78243D88CC651FA70B4BDBE.description: Simplify algebraic expressions by applying properties of operations of numbers, using various representations and tools, in different contexts

536D0572F634433B94982DDEAC535CEC.description: Compare algebraic expressions using concrete, numerical, graphical, and algebraic methods to identify those that are equivalent, and justify their choices

71A5A797CC2442B6B6CB264CCEC978F5.description: Create algebraic expressions to generalize relationships expressed in words, numbers, and visual representations, in various contexts

E72D0889628343549A52B4F0B81E694E.description: Research an algebraic concept to tell a story about its development and use in a specific culture, and describe its relevance in a current context

A433CDDDE66443668D63F6F8985B0079.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the development and use of algebraic concepts and of their connection to numbers, using various tools and representations

1C313D07CDB442D899CD2A42400C57FF.description: Pose and solve problems involving rates, percentages, and proportions in various contexts, including contexts connected to real-life applications of data, measurement, geometry, linear relations, and financial literacy

ADE4922D760149E88EC36B3FDBF26B8D.description: Solve problems involving operations with positive and negative fractions and mixed numbers, including problems involving formulas, measurements, and linear relations, using technology when appropriate

54DDB1276B7C47FDB35BBB21E95790ED.description: Apply an understanding of integers to explain the effects that positive and negative signs have on the values of ratios, rates, fractions, and decimals, in various contexts

E043FCA9D313406EB7FC245D950C7284.description: Apply an understanding of unit fractions and their relationship to other fractional amounts, in various contexts, including the use of measuring tools

46A7EE162A7D4C38AE2EAF9900DAD30B.description: Apply an understanding of integers to describe location, direction, amount, and changes in any of these, in various contexts

08ED3614816740CA88F4C8B13832EBE5.description: Apply an understanding of rational numbers, ratios, rates, percentages, and proportions, in various mathematical contexts, and to solve problems

3B2EC271F0CF4DDEB422F3131C4DEF0C.description: Analyse, through the use of patterning, the relationships between the exponents of powers and the operations with powers, and use these relationships to simplify numeric and algebraic expressions

9182A97BF77D435A95FB640E4EA3932F.description: Analyse, through the use of patterning, the relationship between the sign and size of an exponent and the value of a power, and use this relationship to express numbers in scientific notation and evaluate powers

2A45063CA58E4F7FB5594E1F144F99CD.description: Represent numbers in various ways, evaluate powers, and simplify expressions by using the relationships between powers and their exponents

B391F5E418F947969E933BAF95FF4620.description: Use patterns and number relationships to explain density, infinity, and limit as they relate to number sets

F8DD5B0499ED43318C82DBB14C960E74.description: Describe how various subsets of a number system are defined, and describe similarities and differences between these subsets

FDFC9F139D7C4C79A70AEC83FC7686A6.description: Research a number concept to tell a story about its development and use in a specific culture, and describe its relevance in a current context

200DDEB6FB924CA6971510019FEDAEF6.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the development and use of numbers, and make connections between sets of numbers

416BA82724214B069262BF018D3AAB4D.description: Make connections between mathematics and various knowledge systems, their lived experiences, and various real-life applications of mathematics, including careers

B0D179D5A9DE4E84974DE8CC78B63B37.description: Apply the mathematical processes to develop a conceptual understanding of, and procedural fluency with, the mathematics they are learning

5AEB8D3F3800493C9CDA83753D67C9FE.description: Developing critical and creative mathematical thinking

B1A014732C95435F8BCDC320F346D5AF.description: Developing a healthy mathematical identity through building self-awareness

0FDA3533104D463D90E78C0D97160319.description: Building healthy relationships and communicating effectively in mathematics

C1BA653A42914FCAA6E39DAE51EAADF8.description: Identifying resources and supports that aid perseverance in mathematical learning

D5FB1CF2C66C40A8BFCC3AA9B32C3B89.description: Recognizing sources of stress that present challenges to mathematical learning

A7C575638993499FBA84696969E96B17.description: Recognizing and identifying emotions that support mathematical learning

0E435816BE56439D9CA2AF471AF41768.description: Develop and explore a variety of social-emotional learning skills in a context that supports and reflects this learning in connection with the expectations across all other strands
